description:
If you run 'nova ssh <name>' and the instance has no public IP addresses, the error message you get is:

    ERROR: 'public'

This should be made a bit more friendly.
title: Error message for 'nova ssh' should be improved

comments.content:
If you run 'nova ssh <name>' and the instance has no public IP addresses, the error message you get is:

    ERROR: 'public'

This should be made a bit more friendly.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~russellb

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/6003
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/6003
Committed: http://github.com/openstack/python-novaclient/commit/2db73cd5a1facb888d9c1cfb75d350b8b53f9a0e
Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit 2db73cd5a1facb888d9c1cfb75d350b8b53f9a0e
Author: Russell Bryant <email address hidden>
Date:   Fri Mar 30 14:34:57 2012 -0400

    Improve 'nova ssh' error message.
    
    Fix bug 969499.
    
    If you ran "nova ssh <name>" and the instance has no public IP
    addresses, the output you got was:
    
        ERROR: 'public'
    
    This patch makes it so you get a friendlier error in this case:
    
        ERROR: No public addresses found for '<name>'.
    
    Change-Id: I176decf90f472f9b0768e4d0c2bcabd55fe7198a
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack
